Description: Marl pottery cylinder jar with modelled arch pattern in band around the upper body and decorated with red paint in a cross-hatched pattern.
Curator's comments: Like 46d2 in Petrie’s Corpus of Proto-dynastic Pottery (1953). This vase is from Garstang’s excavations in the Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis, but was not found within a grave and is marked only with F (for Fort) on the exterior. For publication of the surviving records of Garstang’s excavations see B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis, London (1987).
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
